thread.title: Berdych beats Sock to win 3rd Stockholm Open title
thread.title_full: Berdych beats Sock to win 3rd Stockholm Open title

author: There's An 'Eerily Untouched' WWII Bomber Sitting In Hawaii
title: Berdych beats Sock to win 3rd Stockholm Open title
text:
Berdych beats Sock to win 3rd Stockholm Open title Associated Press 9 hrs ago STOCKHOLM (AP) Top-seeded Tomas Berdych won the Stockholm Open for a third time on Sunday, beating American Jack Sock 7-6 (1), 6-2 in the final.
AdChoices Berdych didn't drop a set in the tournament and secured his second title of the year after winning in Shenzhen last month.
Sock was up a break in the first set but failed to serve it out at 5-4, and Berdych then dominated the tiebreaker. The Czech player didn't face a break point in the second set, winning all 12 points on his first serve.
Berdych, who had already qualified for the season-ending ATP tour finals, said ''I've definitely built up a good history here, which always helps. ... Sometimes you find a place in the world that suits you well, and it's the case here.''
